Context:
The Personal Support Worker (PSW) program at George Brown College is a two-semester Ontario College Certificate program with the code C112. It teaches students the skills required to assist clients with their personal and household needs, ensuring their comfort and safety. The classes are held at the Daphne Cockwell Centre for Health Sciences at Waterfront Campus from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Monday through Friday. Students can expect clinical practicums in various settings across the Greater Toronto Area (GTA), with shift hours varying between day and evenings depending on the practice setting. Domestic tuition for this program is $3,912.00. The PSW program has been running at George Brown College for over 20 years.

Program Name: Personal Support Worker
Code: C112
Credential: Ontario College Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 2 semesters
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $3,912.00
Centre: Health Sciences
School: Sally Horsfall Eaton School of Nursing
Location: Waterfront Campus
Experiential Learning: Clinical Placement
Classes held between: 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Monday through Friday
Duration of the program: 2 years
Years of operation: Over 20 years

Context: The Personal Support Worker (PSW) program at George Brown College focuses on providing personal care for various populations, including the frail elderly, chronically ill, physically disabled individuals in the community and long-term care facilities, ambulatory care settings, acute medical and surgical settings, and palliative care. Students are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to complete clinical placements. The program offers a variety of clinical placement experiences, including supervised placements in institutional and community settings and an interprofessional Simulation Centre experience. Graduates can find employment in various settings such as ambulatory care, long-term care facilities, residential and supportive housing, community support agencies, acute medical, and palliative care settings. George Brown College PSW graduates have the opportunity to apply for further education in programs like the PSW Pathway to Practical Nursing program (S119), Practical Nursing program (S121), and Interprofessional Complex and Long-Term Care postgraduate certificate (S417).
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Personal Support Worker Program (PSW) C112 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The text provides information about the courses offered in two semesters (Semester 1 and Semester 2) within a Personal Support Worker (PSW) program at an unspecified college. The courses cover topics such as client care, human body, communication skills, supportive care, mental health, palliative care, nutrition, and support in facility and community settings. Some course names include PSW 1001: Role of the PSW in Client Care, CARE 1101: Providing Support in a Facility Setting, and CARE 1113: Mental Health & Palliative Care.

The graduate learning outcomes of this program indicate that they will be able to work within the personal support worker role in various care settings, practice professionally as a PSW, collaborate with interprofessional teams, provide person-centered care, establish and maintain therapeutic relationships, identify relevant client information, and create a safe environment for clients.

Context:
The text mentions several roles and responsibilities of Personal Support Workers (PSWs) in assisting clients across the lifespan with activities of daily living, medication administration, household management services, supporting caregivers, identifying and reporting potential situations of abuse or neglect, providing holistic health care, and advocacy for culturally safe and spiritually sensitive palliative and end-of-life care.

Additionally, the text provides information on tuition fees for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2023 and Fall 2024. The estimated domestic tuition fee for Fall 2023 is $3,912.00, while the estimated domestic tuition fee for Fall 2024 is not specified in the text. However, it's mentioned that tuition fees are subject to board approval.

Therefore, the extracted information includes:
- Roles and responsibilities of Personal Support Workers
- Tuition fees for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2023 ($3,912.00) and potential tuition fees for programs starting in Fall 2024 (not specified in the text).

Context:
* The program starts in Fall 2024.
* Tuition fees are subject to board approval but material, student service and ancillary fees are estimated.
* Financial assistance is approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet eligibility criteria.
* Applicants need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, a grade 12 English (C or U), or mature student status (19 years of age or older and no OSSD) with English requirements met through the Admissions Assessment or upgrading.
* Course exemptions may be granted for college or university credits.
* The program is open to domestic applicants only.
* Special Requirements include:
  - Completing mandatory Pre-placement requirements within 8 to 10 weeks upon acceptance, which includes providing medical records, a clear Vulnerable Sector Check renewed every year, a Standard First Aid Certificate renewed every three years, a Basic Life Support certificate renewed every year, an annual flu shot and a mask fit test renewed every two years.
  - COVID-19 vaccination is recommended for people working with vulnerable communities.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Personal Support Worker Program (PSW) C112 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
* Public Health recommends that students working with vulnerable communities be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 for clinical placements.
* Clinical agency partners require students to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.
* Students who are not vaccinated are at risk of not being able to complete their clinical placement course requirements.
* Students who do not comply with health policy and non-academic requirements, or who do not submit all required documentation by deadlines will be excluded from the clinical practicum.
* Exclusion from clinical practicum may jeopardize students' academic standing and successful completion of the program.
* All costs associated with health requirements are the responsibility of the student.
* Students must have a Vulnerable Sector Check completed and renewed every year before entering into field or clinical placement.
* The Vulnerable Sector Check process can take two to three months, but under some circumstances can take four to eight months.
* Students are responsible for ensuring that the Vulnerable Sector Check covers appropriateness for "individuals being employed and/or volunteering who will be working with vulnerable person(s)."
* Students must keep the original copy of their Vulnerable Sector Check.
* Students unable to provide a "clear" Vulnerable Sector Check will not be able to start their field or clinical placement and will therefore be unable to complete the program.
* Failure to meet requirements for field placement may prevent students from completing the program and/or securing employment.
* Vulnerable Sector Checks are required to protect clientele of placement partner agencies, who are considered "vulnerable persons" under the law.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Personal Support Worker Program (PSW) C112 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The George Brown College offers various nursing and health care programs including Practical Nursing (PN), Personal Support Worker Pathway to Practical Nursing (S119), and Bachelor of Science in Nursing (B.Sc.N.) (S118). Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colages. The fees for a vulnerable sector check vary and must be paid by the student. For more information, please visit the Clinical Pre-placement website.

Contact Information:
- Sally Horsfall Eaton School of Nursing
- Phone: 416-415-5000, ext. 2367
- Email: nursing@georgebrown.ca
- Office Hours: Monday to Thursday, 8 a.m. – 4:30 p.m. & Friday 8 a.m. – 4 p.m.

Related Programs:
- Practical Nursing (PN) (S121)
- Personal Support Worker Pathway to Practical Nursing (S119)
- Bachelor of Science in Nursing (B.Sc.N.) (S118)

Testimonial:
- Name: Mira Glogauer
- Program: Ontario College Certificate
- Quote: "Upon graduating from the Personal Support Worker program at George Brown College, I can honestly say that my life is changed for the better. The course work was gruelling and the practical exhausting but I have never had such a great experience with a school. To your professors you are not just a student number, you are someone who could one day be taking care of family members and loved ones. The amount of time and effort my clinical instructor put into my education was unforgettable. Her care over my academic and emotional well-being will stick with me forever. George Brown College truly prepared me for a exciting future full of meaning."
